Text.Value: All right, I've kept you from your blanket long enough. Rest well.
What do you mean?
Fine. Much better than I thought I would, given the circumstances.
Either way, we can't take the lack of symptoms for granted. We have to find a healer.
Anyway, I feel the same. Other than the occasional mental exchange, it's almost as if we're not infected.

EditorData.NodeContext: 'mental exchange' being a conversational term for the mind meld phenomenon they've experienced.

Text.Value: Maybe it's a compliment.
The voice said I'd become a 'beautiful weapon'. What do you think that means?
Hah! Adorable. But your timing is awful.
How do you feel?

EditorData.logicalname: If first party member you speak to

Text.Value: Me too. It's hard to sleep knowing that thing is in your head.
The voice on the ship told me I'd become a 'beautiful weapon'. What do you think it meant?
Honestly? More than a little frightened.
Yes, almost like it's whispering to me still...
Better than I ought to. Other than the occasional mental exchange, it's almost as if we're not infected.

EditorData.NodeContext: 'mental exchange' being a conversational term for the mind meld phenomenon they've experienced.

Text.Value: Either way, we can't take the lack of symptoms for granted. We have to find Halsin.
After they put that tadpole in my eye, I heard this voice. It was... soothing.
Anything's possible. But we still need to find a healer.
I feel... good. It's so strange... do you remember the voice? Aboard the ship?
I don't know. How do you feel?
I couldn't help but overhear... well, all right, I could've helped, but didn't.

EditorData.logicalname: If NOT first party member you speak to

Text.Value: Whatever the mind flayers' plans were, those dragons spoiled them. That doesn't make our situation less dangerous.
Whatever they were, those plans were interrupted by the dragons.
I suppose so. They've certainly been useful in a tight spot...
We should discuss this.
Yes... me as well. Besides the occasional mental exchange, it's almost as if we're not infected.

EditorData.NodeContext: 'mental exchange' being a conversational term for the mind meld phenomenon they've experienced.

Text.Value: For now. But we can't take the lack of symptoms for granted. We have to keep looking for Halsin.
But other than the occasional mental exchange, it's almost as if we're not infected.
Who knows? Could've been a hallucination. I'm just glad we're still alive.
It's so strange... do you remember the voice? From the ship?
Sounds like it had plans for us.
I've said my piece. Good night.
Sorry... but a problem shared, and so on. We should discuss this.

EditorData.NodeContext: A little apologetic for bringing up a tricky subject (their infection) but still pressing the issue

Text.Value: For now. But we can't take the lack of symptoms for granted. We have to keep looking for a healer.
Weapon...? Might be connected to those powers we gained.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: FLAG NEEDED - CHECKING THAT TADPOLE POWERS HAVE BEEN GAINED

Text.Value: Agreed. We can't take the lack of symptoms for granted.
I was trying not to dwell on it, but thank you for reminding me.
The sooner we find a healer, the better. Get some rest.
The sooner we find Halsin, the better. Get some rest.
But there will be a price to pay. We can't take the lack of symptoms for granted.
I don't know. But Halsin might - if we can find him.
Well, I've said my piece. Get some rest.
It's been hard to forget.

Synopsis: The party stops to camp for the night - the second instance of this happening. Shadowheart seeks to confide in the player about what's been happening to them, in particular the tadpole parasite lodged in their heads and the transformation that is supposed to follow. Curiously, they realise that they both feel fine - contrary to what is thought to occur.
